result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont for Zoe Plovanich in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
10/24/17 Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin for Zoe Plovanich in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

COURT CONTINUED THE STAY ON THE BENCH WARRANT.  Review hearing scheduled for October 24, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
MCDRC DPA Report
WCS.  Filed, sdg.

Attorney Zoe Plovanich in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised that she is UNAWARE of her client's whereabouts, however Defendant is compliant with MCDRC.  State moved for a Bench Warrant.  COURT ISSUED AND STAYED A BENCH WARRANT UNTIL THE NEXT DATE.  Review hearing scheduled for September 26, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Betty Monique McGhee in court with attorney Zoe Plovanich.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant will need to complete 'Thinking for a Change' (T4C).  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for August 28, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Betty Monique McGhee in court with attorney Zoe Plovanich.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk: sm

Case in court for deferred prosecustion agreement hearing. The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.  The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Br. 33, Judge Ashley for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for July 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Betty Monique McGhee in court with attorney Zoe Plovanich.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties stipulates to an adjournment for a possible deferred prosecution agreement.  Matter adjourned by the Court.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 8, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Betty Monique McGhee in court with attorney Zoe Plovanich.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request.  Case is adjourned to Br. 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Betty Monique McGhee in court with attorney Zoe Plovanich.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense counsel still in need of discovery. Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 31.  Status conference scheduled for February 6, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.

Defendant Betty Monique McGhee in court with attorney Gina Marie Pruski.  Defendant Betty Monique McGhee in custody.  William P Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 31.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 31 for Scheduling.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 11, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($100.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 100.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Betty Monique McGhee not in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney Colin McGinn was in court earlier.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Betty Monique McGhee in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Defendant Betty Monique McGhee in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 2578 North 16th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Betty Monique McGhee not in court.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 8-11-2015 at 1:30pm
